More than 30 correctional administrators and rights advocates call for the release of vulnerable youth and stoppage of all new admissions.  They also want a clear safety plan for those who remain and to have adequate access to protective measures and better contact with loved ones
Decarceration Response: Office of Juvenile Justice to review cases of all youth in custody to result in furloughs due to medical reasons or early releases as approved by court
Mitigation Measures (quarantine; isolati: OJJ has been limiting the number of visitors, contractors and deliveries on secure care campuses since the onset of the public health crisis. This also includes limiting transports to essential trips only. Per public health guidelines, anyone entering these facilities is being screened including temperature checks. PPE has been distributed throughout the secure care facilities.
Visitation Policy: Suspended visits and limit on number of contractors and deliveries to secure care campuses.
Education Policy: Educational staff no longer reporting and distance learning is implemented.
